text: so Jeremy Corbyn you've had to suspend a
close friend a very close ally how did
that feel my job is to lead the party my
job is to ensure the party bit all
members the party behave in an
appropriate way there were concerns
about the language used by Ken
Livingstone as the work of wanted to
other people and so a number of people a
very small number of people I have to
say in the entire party membership have
been suspended pending investigation
we're not tolerating anti-semitism in
any way or indeed any other kind of
racism within the party it's not
acceptable and not elect Ken Livingstone
was an is a very close friend how did
you feel doing what you've done
obviously very sad but I have a
responsibility to lead the party I'm
hearing of lifelong supporters of the
party who are Jewish you are saying they
will not vote again labour while you are
the leader there are worries about
donations drying up do you accept that
this has become something of a crisis
it's not a crisis there's no crisis
where there is any racism in the party
it will be dealt with be rooted out I
have been an anti-racist campaigner all
my life Labour's credentials as a party
of Tolerance are now being called into
questions how can you say this is not a
Christ who's calling me to question you
it's been discussed I don't have
opinions on putting the question it's
been suggested but the party's
reputation is on the line that's a fear
that's held by many of your colleagues
at the Westminster
apart from anywhere else you suggest
there's no crisis here's our worry about
nothing to worry about there is complete
tolerance in the labour party and there
has to be there has to be an intolerance
of all faiths or communities and points
of view what we won't tolerate is racism
in any form the party membership is the
biggest it's been in my lifetime there's
four hundred thousand individual members
there's a hundred thousand affiliated
supporters there are three million
affiliated trade union members it's a
very big organisation and I suspect that
much of this criticism that you're
saying about Christ in the party
actually comes from those who are
nervous at the strength of the Labour
Party at local level so you believe
there is no crisis to be concerned about
at all it is a perception being whipped
up by your critics and that we have
dealt with
any cases brought to my attention of any
degree of intolerance in the party the
number of cases is very very small
indeed and you won't be doing any more
beyond that the steps if any cases are
brought to my attention they will be
dealt with immediately as they all have
been so far
